1.q_string: Two insulated charged copper spheres A and B have their centres separated by a distance of \(50 \mathrm{~cm}\). What is the mutual force of electrostatic repulsion if the charge on each is \(6.5 \times 10^{-7} C\) each? The radii of \(\mathrm{A}\) and \(\mathrm{B}\) are negligible compared to the distance of separation.
Which among the curves shown in Fig. cannot possibly represent electrostatic field lines?

A charge of \(8 \mathrm{mC}\) is located at the origin. Calculate the work done in taking a small charge of \(-2 \times 10^{-9} \mathrm{C}\) from a point \(P(0,0,3 \mathrm{~cm})\) to a point \(Q(0,4 \mathrm{~cm}, 0)\), via a point \(R(0,6 \mathrm{~cm}, 9 \mathrm{~cm})\).

Three resistors \(2 \Omega, 4 \Omega\) and \(5 \Omega\) are combined in parallel. What is the total resistance of the combination?
Current density is a __________.

In a chamber, a uniform magnetic field of \(6.5 \mathrm{G}\left(1 \mathrm{G}=10^{-4} \mathrm{~T}\right)\) is maintained. An electron is shot into the field with a speed of \(4.8 \times 10^6 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{-1}\) normal to the field. Determine the radius of the circular orbit. \(\left(e=1.6 \times 10^{-19} \mathrm{C}, \mathrm{m}_e=\right.\) \(\left.9.1 \times 10^{-31} \mathrm{~kg}\right)\).

A magnetic needle free to rotate in a vertical plane parallel to the magnetic meridian has its north tip pointing down at \(22^{\circ}\) with the horizontal. The horizontal component of the earth's magnetic field at the place is known to be \(0.35 \mathrm{G}\). Determine the magnitude of the earth's magnetic field at the place:
What does a superconductor exhibit?

A jet plane is travelling towards the west at a speed of \(1800 \mathrm{~km} / \mathrm{h}\). Determine the voltage difference developed between the ends of the wing having a span of \(25 \mathrm{~m}\), if the Earth's magnetic field at the location has a magnitude of \(5 \times 10^{-4} \mathrm{~T}\) and the dip angle is \(30^{\circ}\).
Which of the following factors is the self inductance associated with a coil is independent of?
A \(44 \mathrm{mH}\) inductor is connected to \(220 \mathrm{~V}, 50 \mathrm{~Hz}\) ac supply. Determine the rms value of the current in the circuit:

A plane electromagnetic wave travels in vacuum along the z-direction. What can you say about the directions of its electric and magnetic field vectors? If the frequency of the wave is \(30 \mathrm{MHz}\), what is its wavelength?
Electromagnetic waves are produced by:

Double-convex lenses are to be manufactured from a glass of refractive index \(1.55\), with both faces of the same radius of curvature. What is the radius of curvature required if the focal length is to be \(20 \mathrm{~cm}\)?
Which among the following phenomena of light results in a mirage?

In Young's double-slit experiment, \(0.28 \mathrm{~mm}\) separation between the slits and the screen is placed \(1.4 \mathrm{~m}\) away. \(1.2 \mathrm{~cm}\) is the distance between the central bright fringe and the fourth bright fringe. Determine the wavelength of light used in the experiment.
What is the locus of all particles in a medium vibrating in the same phase called?

The work function of caesium metal is \(2.14 \mathrm{eV}\). When light of frequency \(6 \times 10^{14} \mathrm{~Hz}\) is incident on the metal surface, photoemission of electrons occurs. What is the maximum kinetic energy of the emitted electrons?

The radionuclide \({ }^{11} \mathrm{C}\) decays according to

\({ }_6^{11} \mathrm{C} \rightarrow{ }_5^{11} \mathrm{~B}+e^{+}+v: \quad T_{1 / 2}=20.3 \mathrm{~min}\)

The maximum energy of the emitted positron is \(0.960 \mathrm{MeV}\).

Given the mass values:

\(\mathrm{m}\left({ }^{11}{ }_6 \mathrm{C}\right)=11.011434 \mathrm{u}\) and

\(\mathrm{m}\left({ }^{11}{ }_6 \mathrm{~B}\right)=11.009305 \mathrm{u}\),

Calculate \(\mathrm{Q}\) and compare it with the maximum energy of the positron emitted.
Electrons in the atom are held to the nucleus by:
What happens to the quality factor of an LCR circuit if the resistance is increased?

In a p-n junction diode, the current I can be expressed as:

\(I=I_0 \exp \left(\frac{e V}{2 k_B T}-1\right)\)

where \(\mathrm{I}_0\) is called the reverse saturation current, \(\mathrm{V}\) is the voltage across the diode and is positive for forward bias and negative for reverse bias, and \(\mathrm{I}\) is the current through the diode, \(\mathrm{k}_{\mathrm{B}}\) is the Boltzmann constant \(\left(8.6 \times 10^{-5} \mathrm{eV} / \mathrm{K}\right)\) and \(\mathrm{T}\) is the absolute temperature. If for a given diode \(\mathrm{I}_0=5 \times 10^{-12} \mathrm{~A}\) and \(\mathrm{T}=300 \mathrm{~K}\), then what will be the forward current at a forward voltage of \(0.6 \mathrm{~V}\)?

q_option: reduces the majority carrier current to zero.
